5#ifndef V8_FLAGS_FLAGS_H_
6#define V8_FLAGS_FLAGS_H_
7
8#include "src/base/optional.h"
9#include "src/common/globals.h"
10
11#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
12// Include the wasm-limits.h header for some default values of Wasm flags.
13// This can be reverted once we can use designated initializations (C++20) for
14// {v8_flags} (defined in flags.cc) instead of specifying the default values in
15// the header and using the default constructor.
16#include "src/wasm/wasm-limits.h"
17#endif
18
19namespace v8::internal {
20
21// The value of a single flag (this is the type of all v8_flags.* fields).
22template <typename T>
23class FlagValue {
24 // {FlagValue} types will be memory-protected in {FlagList::FreezeFlags}.
25 // We currently allow the following types to be used for flags:
26 // - Arithmetic types like bool, int, size_t, double; those will trivially be
27 // protected.
28 // - base::Optional<bool>, which is basically a POD, and can also be
29 // protected.
30 // - const char*, for which we currently do not protect the actual string
31 // value. TODO(12887): Also protect the string storage.
32 //
33 // Other types can be added as needed, after checking that memory protection
34 // works for them.
35 static_assert(std::is_same_v<std::decay_t<T>, T>);
36 static_assert(std::is_arithmetic_v<T> ||
37 std::is_same_v<base::Optional<bool>, T> ||
38 std::is_same_v<const char*, T>);
39
40 public:
41 using underlying_type = T;
42 explicit constexpr FlagValue(T value) : value_(value) {}
43
44 // Implicitly convert to a {T}. Not marked {constexpr} so we do not get
45 // compiler warnings about dead code (when checking readonly flags).
46 operator T() const { return value_; }
47
48 // Explicitly convert to a {T} via {value()}. This is {constexpr} so we can
49 // use it for computing other constants.
50 constexpr T value() const { return value_; }
51
52 // Assign a new value (defined below).
53 inline FlagValue<T>& operator=(T new_value);
54
55 private:
56 T value_;
57};
58
59// Declare a struct to hold all of our flags.
60struct alignas(kMinimumOSPageSize) FlagValues {
61 FlagValues() = default;
62 // No copying, moving, or assigning. This is a singleton struct.
63 FlagValues(const FlagValues&) = delete;
64 FlagValues(FlagValues&&) = delete;
65 FlagValues& operator=(const FlagValues&) = delete;
66 FlagValues& operator=(FlagValues&&) = delete;
67
68#define FLAG_MODE_DECLARE
69#include "src/flags/flag-definitions.h" // NOLINT(build/include)
70#undef FLAG_MODE_DECLARE
71};
72
73V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE extern FlagValues v8_flags;
74
75// The global list of all flags.
76class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE FlagList {
77 public:
78 class HelpOptions {
79 public:
80 enum ExitBehavior : bool { kExit = true, kDontExit = false };
81
82 explicit HelpOptions(ExitBehavior exit_behavior = kExit,
83 const char* usage = nullptr)
84 : exit_behavior_(exit_behavior), usage_(usage) {}
85
86 bool ShouldExit() { return exit_behavior_ == kExit; }
87 bool HasUsage() { return usage_ != nullptr; }
88 const char* usage() { return usage_; }
89
90 private:
91 ExitBehavior exit_behavior_;
92 const char* usage_;
93 };
94
95 // Set the flag values by parsing the command line. If remove_flags is
96 // set, the recognized flags and associated values are removed from (argc,
97 // argv) and only unknown arguments remain. Returns 0 if no error occurred.
98 // Otherwise, returns the argv index > 0 for the argument where an error
99 // occurred. In that case, (argc, argv) will remain unchanged independent of
100 // the remove_flags value, and no assumptions about flag settings should be
101 // made. If exit_behavior is set to Exit and --help has been specified on the
102 // command line, then the usage string will be printed, if it was specified,
103 // followed by the help flag and then the process will exit. Otherwise the
104 // flag help will be displayed but execution will continue.
105 //
106 // The following syntax for flags is accepted (both '-' and '--' are ok):
107 //
108 // --flag (bool flags only)
109 // --no-flag (bool flags only)
110 // --flag=value (non-bool flags only, no spaces around '=')
111 // --flag value (non-bool flags only)
112 // -- (capture all remaining args in JavaScript)
113 static int SetFlagsFromCommandLine(
114 int* argc, char** argv, bool remove_flags,
115 FlagList::HelpOptions help_options = FlagList::HelpOptions());
116
117 // Set the flag values by parsing the string str. Splits string into argc
118 // substrings argv[], each of which consisting of non-white-space chars,
119 // and then calls SetFlagsFromCommandLine() and returns its result.
120 static int SetFlagsFromString(const char* str, size_t len);
121
122 // Freeze the current flag values (disallow changes via the API).
123 static void FreezeFlags();
124
125 // Returns true if the flags are currently frozen.
126 static bool IsFrozen();
127
128 // Free dynamically allocated memory of strings. This is called during
129 // teardown; flag values cannot be used afterwards any more.
130 static void ReleaseDynamicAllocations();
131
132 // Print help to stdout with flags, types, and default values.
133 static void PrintHelp();
134
135 static void PrintValues();
136
137 // Reset some contradictory flags provided on the command line during
138 // fuzzing.
139 static void ResolveContradictionsWhenFuzzing();
140
141 // Set flags as consequence of being implied by another flag.
142 static void EnforceFlagImplications();
143
144 // Hash of flags (to quickly determine mismatching flag expectations).
145 // This hash is calculated during V8::Initialize and cached.
146 static uint32_t Hash();
147
148 private:
149 // Reset the flag hash on flag changes. This is a private method called from
150 // {FlagValue<T>::operator=}; there should be no need to call it from any
151 // other place.
152 static void ResetFlagHash();
153
154 // Make {FlagValue<T>} a friend, so it can call {ResetFlagHash()}.
155 template <typename T>
156 friend class FlagValue;
157};
158
159template <typename T>
160FlagValue<T>& FlagValue<T>::operator=(T new_value) {
161 if (new_value != value_) {
162 FlagList::ResetFlagHash();
163 value_ = new_value;
164 }
165 return *this;
166}
167
168} // namespace v8::internal
169
170#endif // V8_FLAGS_FLAGS_H_
